conclusion: Analyze the current lighting conditions based on the shadows.
Shadows A (from the egg) and B, C, D (from the alarm clock) are cast towards the lower right relative to their respective objects.
The current light source is positioned somewhere above and to the upper left of the objects.
Shadows are always cast in the direction opposite to the light source's horizontal position relative to the object, and its vertical position determines the angle and length of the shadow.
The elongation of the shadows suggests the light source is not directly overhead but at an angle.
Understand the new position of the light source.
The light source moves 'to the right, directly above the objects.'
The light source's final horizontal position is roughly aligned with the objects, and its vertical position is high up relative to the ground.
Moving 'to the right' suggests its horizontal position shifts from being to the left to being horizontally aligned with or to the right of the objects.
'Directly above the objects' implies the light rays will be more vertical compared to the current angle.
Predict the change in shadow location.
When the light source moves to be directly above the objects, shadows will be cast directly below the objects.
Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift their position to be directly beneath the egg and the alarm clock.
Predict the change in shadow size and shape.
The length and size of a shadow depend on the angle of the light rays hitting the object and the ground.
When the light source moves directly above the object, shadows become shorter and more compact.
The shape of the shadow will be a projection of the object's profile from directly above.
Apply the predictions to shadows A, B, C, and D.
Shadow A will move to be directly beneath the egg and become much shorter and more circular.
Shadows B, C, D will move to be directly beneath the alarm clock and consolidate into a single, shorter shadow area.
Summarize the changes for A, B, C, and D.
Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift from their current position to a position directly beneath the objects.
